result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron Darnell Blunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Laron Darnell Blunt not in court.  Andrea L Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's was in absconder status, however did have contact and now probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
received and filed.

Defendant Laron Darnell Blunt in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served. Concurrent to count 2.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days served. Concurrent to count 1.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 40 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees.

*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

DEFENDANT'S PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS
MOTION IN LIMINE, FILED

Defendant Laron Darnell Blunt in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case calendared for jury trial. State is awaiting 1 officer but parties remain ready for jury trial. Defense files motion in limine which are discussed on the record. Case passed. 

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES. 
Case remains on for jury trial. State still unable to locate Officer Butler. State requests additional time to locate officer. Defense requests adjournment of trial for reasons stated on the record. State objects. Court denies request for adjournment. Case passed. 

CASE RECALLED.  
Defendant Laron Darnell Blunt in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren. Student Intern Jon Josephsen under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Angela Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution. Case proceeded to plea hearing.

AMENDED AS TO COUNT 2, On motion of the State, Repeater modifiers 939.62(1)(a) be dismissed. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND AMENDED COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
